caption: Vegan Gluten Free Vanilla Cupcakes!! Perfectly soft, fluffy and sweet topped with a light coconut cream frosting. And they’re ez pz to make in 1-bowl with just 9 ingredients! ⁣ ⁣ Snag the recipe via link in bio! 👉🏻 https://user_37.com/vegan-gluten-free-vanilla-cupcakes/⁣ ⁣ Recipe development process: ⁣ ⁣ Yesterday I posted a quick story on banana muffins with certain gf flours and I had a lot of feedback asking how I came up with the ratio, how to bake with gf flours etc so I thought I’d share recipe development for some recipes :) ⁣ ⁣ This was probably the most finicky and trickiest recipe to develop because of how simple yet delicate vanilla cupcakes are flavour and texture wise. There’s a reason why chocolate cakes are easier to make and more forgiving, but for vanilla cakes anything weird WILL be noticed. ⁣ ⁣ If you’ve ever seen any of my muffin/cupcake recipes, you’ll notice I always go back to my fav combo of oat flour, almond flour and some kind of starch. But for these, because vanilla is the main flavour I used almond flour, rice flour and potato starch. ⁣ ⁣ First I played around with oat flour, apple sauce, aquafaba, brown rice flour, tapioca starch, corn starch, cashew butter etc but they didn’t meet the expectations and either tasted too strong in their flavour or texture was off. Here’s what the end team looks like: ⁣ ⁣ ▪️Almond flour: gives a rich and buttery flavour and texture without any added butter/oil⁣ ▪️Rice flour: is super light and helps with the density of almond flour and also gives it that nice slight chew texture missing from gf flours ⁣ ▪️ Potato starch: makes it extra light and helps bind ⁣ ⁣ Then we have a bit of coconut yogurt to replace the eggs and add moisture, cane sugar for sweetness and baking soda + baking powder to make sure they rise. ⁣ ⁣ I also added in some tips and tricks for perfect flat top cupcakes perfect for frosting ☺️ I hope you guys enjoy this one!! ⁣

Cereously this is kinda cute. But I also don't really know how to eat this. Do I pour milk in it? Won't it get soggy? 😂 I decided to try it with waffles because they're waaaaay crispier. ⁣ ⁣ Were they good? Well yeah, it's mini waffles!! Plus doesn't take much time at all since I just cut them into squares but admittedly kinda fun to eat and I only need one hand. ⁣ ⁣ I used my go-to waffle recipe that I've stuck to since going vegan, they kinda taste like eggo-- superrrr crispy! Here's the recipe for those of you that asked (the same larger one in my story):⁣ ⁣ Ingredients (for 2 large waffles)⁣ 2/3 cup non dairy milk (160ml // I like using lite canned coconut milk makes it richer)⁣ 1 tsp apple cider vinegar⁣ 2 tbsp maple syrup (40g)⁣ 1 tbsp tahini (15g)⁣ 2 tsp vanilla⁣ 1/2-1 tsp almond extract (optional) ⁣ 3/4 cup oat flour + 2 tbsp oat flour (100g)⁣ 2 tbsp corn starch (15g)⁣ 2 tsp baking powder⁣ 1/4 cup blueberries (optional)⁣ 2 tbsp chocolate chips (optional) ⁣ ⁣ Method:⁣ Combine almond milk and ACV together and let it sit for 3 minutes. Whisk in maple syrup, tahini, vanilla extract and almond extract. Sift in oat flour, corn starch and baking powder. Stir with chopsticks or fork until just combined. Then use a spatula and scrape the sides of the bowl inwards 1-2 times. Let the batter sit for 5 ish minutes. In the mean time, pre-heat waffle iron to medium. Add in the batter and cook for 4-5 ish minutes or until you can lift the waffle iron up without it breaking in half. Then cut them into bite sized pieces or eat as is. ⁣ ⁣ Hot waffle tip: place waffles on a cooling rack so that they don't get soggy :) You can also freeze these!

#ad This all-in-one Sesame Tempeh Rice Bake encompasses everything this month has been asking of me:⁣ ⁣ 〰️Quick & Easy: simply mix and bake all the ingredients – that's it (YES!).⁣ 〰️Convenient: This is a “use whatever veggies you have in the fridge' concept.⁣ 〰️Packed with Protein: I used @lightlifefoods Original Tempeh which packs 18g of protein per servings (it also crisps up perfectly with the marinade on it!)⁣ #Lightlife 〰️Comforting: satisfying and mega flavourful with all the flavours from the sesame ginger sauce coming through.⁣ ⁣ Can feed your whole family or be kept for meal prep. Win, win in all situations!!⁣ ⁣ Sesame Tempeh Rice Bake:⁣ ⁣ Marinade: ⁣ • 1 tbsp Asian sesame butter⁣ • 1 tbsp sesame oil ⁣ • 1/2 tbsp toasted sesame seeds⁣ • 3 garlic cloves, minced ⁣ • 2 tbsp ginger grated⁣ • 1/4 cup light soy sauce ⁣ • 2 tbsp maple syrup⁣ • 2 tbsp rice vinegar⁣ • 1 tbsp corn starch⁣ • 1 tsp sambal oelek, optional ⁣ ⁣ ⁣ Casserole:⁣ • 1 package of Lightlife Organic Original Tempeh⁣ • 1 cup long grain jasmine rice ⁣ • 1.5 lbs // 4-6 cups chopped vegetables of choice, I.e. onions, broccoli, carrots, sugar snap peas, peppers (1.5 cup vegetable broth or water⁣ ⁣ Garnish:⁣ • Green onions⁣ • Sesame Seeds⁣ ⁣ Method: ⁣ 1. Cube the tempeh into 3/4 inch pieces. Add all the marinade ingredients into a shallow container and mix until combined. Add in the tempeh and let it marinade while preparing the rest of the dish.⁣ ⁣ 2. Pre-heat oven to 375 F. Rinse the rice and set aside. Chop up all the vegetables into bite sized pieces. If using onions and/or carrots add those to the bottom of the 9x13 inch casserole dish first. Evenly spread the rice over the casserole dish. Add on the rest of the vegetables and pour over the vegetable broth. Make sure the rice is fully submerged under the water. Add the tempeh pieces on top and then pour in the remaining marinade on top.⁣ ⁣ 3. Tightly cover with foil and bake at 375 F for 40 minutes. Remove from the oven, gently mix and then continue baking for another 20-25 minutes or until rice is fully cooked. Let it cool for 5 minutes before serving and garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds... and devour!

⁣Current go-to lunch situation: 1-pot throw whatever you have in the fridge/left over soy milk rice porridge. It’s been keeping my warm through this cold weather that I’m sooOOoo over 😭 ⁣ ⁣ Here’s a *rough* recipe if any of you want to give it a try! ⁣ ⁣ Soup base: ⁣ - 1/2 cup kombu dashi (or 1/2 cup water + 2 tsp dashi granules) ⁣ - 1 cup soy milk⁣ - 3/4 - 1 cup cooked rice ⁣ ⁣ And today I added: ⁣ - Kabocha⁣ - Carrots ⁣ - Bok Choy ⁣ - Shiitake mushrooms ⁣ - Silken tofu ⁣ - Sugar snap peas⁣ ⁣ Basically just add the soup base into a pot over medium high heat along with all the vegetables. Let it simmer until the vegetables are nice and cooked and then add in the rice. Turn off the heat and just let it sit for 3 minutes until the rice is heated through. Serve and top it off with green onions and sesame seeds 😛

Their instant oats are gluten free and their maple brown sugar was my go to back in the day when I was in uni cause it was the easiest to customize. ⁣ ⁣ I know instant oats kinda have a bad rep *guys I know.. I was in uni before too* but!! After a year of dorm food, I figured out how to actually make it taste good and now I love the consistency of instant oats! Plus, they're super convenient.⁣ ⁣ How to Make Perfect Instant Oatmeal *Taste ~Fancy~*⁣ 1. Use hot cashew or oat milk instead of water. Seriously. It's actually creamy! + after its done cooking, add a bit more on top to keep it from drying out. ⁣ 2. Add in 1-2 tbsp of whole rolled oats. It adds more body and texture! ⁣ 3. Add in fresh and/or dried fruit! It makes it sweeter + more textures.⁣ 4. Add whole nuts or seeds for texture⁣ 5. Add a generous dallop of nut or seed butter, for more creaminess & texture⁣ 6. Optional: if you're feeling extra fancy throw on some chocolate chips, drizzle maple syrup and dash on some cinnamon just cause 😜⁣ ⁣ And you're on your way to a hearty cozy bowl of oats! ⁣ ⁣ Share with me your fav combo of oats below, I wanna know!!

I know it’s far from spring but I had to... 😅 the recipe for perfect chewy, tender & yummy Hanami Dango just went live in the blog! 🍡 ⁣ ⁣ Hanami dango (or Sanshoku dango = 3 coloured dango) is a popular sweet dessert during the spring when it’s cherry blossom season and for the annual Cherry Blossom Viewing (calked Hanami). The name is fitting eh? 😂 I was told that the reason why it’s pink white green in this order is because the flowers start as a pink bud, into a white flower and then into green leaves 🍃 ⁣ ⁣ Dango is one of my fav Japanese desserts. Do you know what the difference is between mochi and dango? Dango is made from 100% rice or sweet rice flour whereas mochi is made from pounding whole rice that then gets steamed.⁣ ⁣ For this Hanami Dango recipe I incorporated my grandmas secret ingredient to get a super bouncy-tender-chewy-mochi-mochi type texture, it’s a ingredient I always have on hand and it’s high in protein 👀!!⁣ ⁣ Dango is super duper easy to make so I hope you try this simple beautiful dango recipe out! 🍡💗 ⁣ ⁣ Full recipe linked in the bio! 👉🏻 https://user_37.com/hanami-dango/⁣
